abstract: The annual benefit dinner for the Bedford Stuyvesant Restoration Corporation, a nonprofit organization with roots dating back to Robert F. Kennedy, gave its annual Founders Award to Lloyd C. Blankfein, Goldman Sachs’ chief executive, who grew up in Brooklyn.
snippet: The annual benefit dinner for the Bedford Stuyvesant Restoration Corporation, a nonprofit organization with roots dating back to Robert F. Kennedy, gave its annual Founders Award to Lloyd C. Blankfein, Goldman Sachs’ chief executive, who grew up i...
lead_paragraph: When you visit Bed-Stuy, you don’t necessarily think of Goldman Sachs.

headline.main: Can’t Take Brooklyn Out of Blankfein
